intro: Dyckia pulchra, commonly known as the pink dyckia, is a striking bromeliad native to Brazil. It features rosettes of narrow, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green with a pinkish or reddish hue. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences bearing small, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Dyckia pulchra is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
